SPONS_AGENCY: Universidad Politécnica de Madrid (UPM)-ETSI Telecomunicación, Av. Complutense, 30, 28040 Madrid, Spain
REFERENCE: Unpublished
REMARKS: This campaign there was a single set of stake measurements, from late January to early February 2014. However, the start of the melting season was very late, nearly coincident with the measurements. NAME: HURD
SPONS_AGENCY: Agencia Estatal de Investigación-Ministerio de Ciencia e Innovación
REFERENCE: Unpublished
REMARKS: Because of Covid-19 pandemic, the field season (which normally includes two set of measurements, at start and end of melting season) was limited to a single set of measurements, in the middle of the summer. Therefore, only annual SMB is provided. Additional ablation after the period of measurements is estimated by comparing stake readings at end of measurement period with stake readings, snow depths & pits at end of subsequent winter.

Summer & winter balances corrected for this comparing stake readings at end of summer with stake readings, snow depths & pits at end of subsequent winter. This season's measurements started almost one month later than usual, which might imply a certain bias in summer and winter balances, although not in the annual balance.

NAME: JOHNSONS
SPONS_AGENCY: Agencia Estatal de Investigación-Ministerio de Ciencia e Innovación
REFERENCE: Unpublished
REMARKS: Because of Covid-19 pandemic, the field season (which normally includes two set of measurements, at start and end of melting season) was limited to a single set of measurements, in the middle of the summer. Therefore, only annual SMB is provided. Additional ablation after the period of measurements is estimated by comparing stake readings at end of measurement period with stake readings, snow depths & pits at end of subsequent winter.

NAME: DEVON ICE CAP NW
REMARKS: Due to COVID restrictions, visitation to any of the Canadian Arcitic glacier monitoring sites was not possible in the spring of 2020. Hence, the glaciological mass-balance had to be derived based on the spring surveys in 2019 [2019-04-18] and in 2021 [2021-05-05]. The balances for the hydrological years 2018/19 and 2019/2020 were estimated using the two-year balance [-1160 mm w.e.] and positive-degree-day sums for the two annual periods.

NAME: DEVON ICE CAP NW
REMARKS: Due to COVID restrictions, visitation to any of the Canadian Arcitic glacier monitoring sites was not possible in the spring of 2020. Hence, the glaciological mass-balance had to be derived based on the spring surveys in 2019 [2019-04-18] and in 2021 [2021-05-05]. The balances for the hydrological years 2018/19 and 2019/2020 were estimated using the two-year balance [-1160 mm w.e.] and positive-degree-day sums for the two annual periods.

NAME: MEIGHEN ICE CAP
REMARKS: Due to COVID restrictions, visitation to any of the Canadian Arcitic glacier monitoring sites was not possible in the spring of 2020. Hence, the glaciological mass-balance had to be derived based on the spring surveys in 2019 [2019-04-08] and in 2021 [2021-04-08]. The balances for the hydrological years 2018/19 and 2019/2020 were estimated using the two-year balance [-1682 mm w.e.] and positive-degree-day sums for the two annual periods.
